gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: School Facilities, derived from Essential Facilities Data of the Multi-Hazard Mitigation Planning Data: Indiana, 2011

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: SCHOOL_FACILITIES_MHMP_IN.SHP is a point shapefile that shows school facilities in Indiana, with the exception of some universities. SCHOOL_FACILITIES_MHMP_IN.SHP was derived from the shapefile named HZSCHOOLS.SHP, which was provided to Indiana Geological Survey personnel by personnel of The Polis Center. This data set was derived by The Polis Center as part of several DMA2000 Multi Hazard Mitigation Planning (MHMP) projects, from data of the Hazards U.S. Multi-Hazards (Hazus-MH MR1, v 1.1) program (data from 2003) developed by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). This data set is more complete in many counties in Indiana than the data set for essential facilities provided by FEMA with the Hazus-MH software. For more information on Hazus-MH, please see the following Web site: http://www.fema.gov/plan/prevent/hazus/hz_overview.shtm The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named HZSCHOOLS.SHP: The original Hazus-MH data from 2003 has been updated for sixty seven counties as part of the DMA2000 Multi- Hazard Mitigation Planning process. Local jurisdiction planning teams provided updated school facility location and attribute information to the Polis Center at IUPUI. The Polis Center used available aerial photography to place or adjust the locations of the facilities on top of the building rooftops.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The predecessor shapefile for SCHOOL_FACILITIES_MHMP_IN.SHP was produced by The Polis Center, as part of an essential facilities database for several DMA2000 Multi-Hazard Mitigation Planning (MHMP) projects to assist communities in preparing hazard mitigation planning document and procedures. The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "This data is used to estimate the damage (and resulting loss of functionality) associated with emergency response facilities for a given flood, hurricane, and/or earthquake scenario. By evaluating this information, the Hazus user can determine whether the emergency response capabilities of the region are likely to be overwhelmed by the flood, hurricane, and/or earthquake scenario."

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: The data may be used as is without any implied warranties on accuracy. DATA DISCLAIMER This data set is provided by The Polis Center and contains data believed to be accurate; however, a degree of error is inherent in all data. This product is distributed "AS-IS" without warranties of any kind, either expressed or implied, including but not limited to warranties of suitability of a particular purpose or use. No attempt has been made in either the designed format or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. CREDIT The following source citation should be included: [SCHOOL_FACILITIES_MHMP_IN: School Facilities in Indiana, derived from Essential Facilities Data of the Multi-Hazard Mitigation Planning Data (The Polis Center, Point Shapefile)]. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. The Polis Center shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. The Polis Center is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

CREDIT It is requested that the following source citation should be included: [SCHOOL_FACILITIES_MHMP_IN: School Facilities in Indiana, derived from Essential Facilities Data of the Multi-Hazard Mitigation Planning Data (The Polis Center, Point Shapefile)]. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000, approximately 1.10 Mb

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "The content of the data was determined by the local juridiction planning team. The data was used with Hazus-MH to perform Flood and Earthquake analyses."

The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "Completeness is based on the date of the Multi-Hazard Mitigation Plan (MHMPP). The MHMPP was performed for each county and all incorporated communities within the jurisdiction. Emergency responders were part of the local planning team and provided the content. Adams 2003 Default Hazus-MH Allen 2003 Default Hazus-MH Bartholomew 2003 Default Hazus-MH Benton 2003 Default Hazus-MH Blackford 2007 MHMPP Boone 2007 MHMPP Brown 2003 Default Hazus-MH Carroll 2003 Default Hazus-MH Cass 2007 MHMPP Clark 2005 MHMPP Clay 2005 MHMPP Clinton 2003 Default Hazus-MH Crawford 2003 MHMPP Daviess 2007 MHMPP Dearborn 2005 MHMPP Decatur 2005 MHMPP De Kalb 2003 Default Hazus-MH Delaware 2003 Default Hazus-MH Dubois 2007 MHMPP Elkhart 2003 Default Hazus-MH Fayette 2005 MHMPP Floyd 2005 MHMPP Fountain 2007 MHMPP Franklin 2005 MHMPP Fulton 2003 Default Hazus-MH Gibson 2005 MHMPP Grant 2007 MHMPP Greene 2005 MHMPP Hamilton 2003 Default Hazus-MH Hancock 2003 Default Hazus-MH Harrison 2005 MHMPP Hendricks 2003 Default Hazus-MH Henry 2005 MHMPP Howard 2003 Default Hazus-MH Huntington 2007 MHMPP Jackson 2005 MHMPP Jasper 2007 MHMPP Jay 2003 Default Hazus-MH Jefferson 2005 MHMPP Jennings 2005 MHMPP Johnson 2007 MHMPP Knox 2005 MHMPP Kosciusko 2007 MHMPP Lagrange 2007 MHMPP Lake 2007 MHMPP La Porte 2003 Default Hazus-MH Lawrence 2005 MHMPP Madison 2003 Default Hazus-MH Marion 2003 Default Hazus-MH Marshall 2007 MHMPP Martin 2005 MHMPP Miami 2007 MHMPP Monroe 2007 MHMPP Montgomery 2003 Default Hazus-MH Morgan 2007 MHMPP Newton 2007 MHMPP Noble 2003 Default Hazus-MH Ohio 2005 MHMPP Orange 2003 MHMPP Owen 2007 MHMPP Parke 2005 MHMPP Perry 2003 MHMPP Pike 2007 MHMPP Porter 2007 MHMPP Posey 2005 MHMPP Pulaski 2007 MHMPP Putnam 2005 MHMPP Randolph 2005 MHMPP Ripley 2005 MHMPP Rush 2007 MHMPP St Joseph 2007 MHMPP Scott 2005 MHMPP Shelby 2007 MHMPP Spencer 2003 MHMPP Starke 2007 MHMPP Steuben 2003 Default Hazus-MH Sullivan 2007 MHMPP Switzerland 2005 MHMPP Tippecanoe 2003 Default Hazus-MH Tipton 2007 MHMPP Union 2005 MHMPP Vanderburgh 2005 Earthquake Study Vermillion 2005 MHMPP Vigo 2005 MHMPP Wabash 2007 MHMPP Warren 2007 MHMPP Warrick 2005 MHMPP Washington 2003 Default Hazus-MH Wayne 2005 MHMPP Wells 2003 Default Hazus-MH White 2007 MHMPP Whitley 2007 MHMPP"

The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "The accuracy of the attributes is unknown. All attributes were not populated as part of the hazard mitigation planning effort."

Accuracy is not better than the source base data (Indiana 2005 aerial orthophotography) used for visual positioning of the features, which is 5 feet at the 95% confidence level for 1-foot imagery (1:2400) and not better than 2.5 feet at the 95% confidence level for 6-inch imagery (1:1200). The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "Indiana 2005 Aerial photography was used to place the school facility locations."

The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile."

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The following is excerpted from metadata supplied by The Polis Center for the source shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP": "For the counties that participated in the MHMP, the 2003 default Hazus-MH MR1 school facilities feature class was exported from Hazus-MH into a county personal geodatabase. The existing facilities were referenced with the aerial photography and points were moved to the building identified on the aerial photography. Additional sources provided by the county were used to add, delete, or modify the list of facilities. A report of the results was presented to planning team members who were given the opportunity to make changes and update attribute values. The planning team edits were made in the personal county geodatabase. At the completion of the planning effort, the county data was imported into the statewide hzschools feature class using CDMS, a data loading tool provided by FEMA. It was then exported to an ESRI Shapefile named "HZSCHOOLS.SHP"."

HZSCHOOLS.SHP was provided to Indiana Geological Survey personnel by POLIS personnel on December 14, 2010. It was reprojected from "GCS North American 1983" datum (latitude/longitude in decimal degrees) to UTM Zone 16, NAD 1983 using the "Data Management Tools > Projection and Transformations > Feature > Project" tool in ESRI ArcToolBox 10.0. It was then renamed to "SCHOOL_FACILITIES_MHMP_IN.SHP" to conform to internal naming conventions of the Indiana Geological Survey.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
School facility locations provided by The Polis Center
School facility locations provided by FEMA on the CD-ROM for Hazus-MH MR1(2003)

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Hazards U.S. Multi-Hazard (Hazus-MH MR1), version 1.1, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Losses from Earthquakes, Floods, and Hurricane Winds

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA); National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
